contentrichtext.text: '''Faisal''' ({{lang-ar|''' فیصل '''}}) is an [[Arabic]] given name and means ''The separator between good and Evil''. '''Faisal''' may refer to: * [[Faisal ibn Turki ibn Abdullah Al Saud]], one of the imams of the [[Second Saudi State]] * [[Faisal bin Turki, Sultan of Muscat and Oman]] * [[Faisal I of Iraq]] and Syria, leader during the [[Arab Revolt]] * [[Faisal II of Iraq]], last King of the [[Kingdom of Iraq]] * [[Faisal of Saudi Arabia]], Third [[King of Saudi Arabia]] * [[Faisal ibn Turki ibn Abdullah Al Saud]], [[Saudi]] ruler of central and eastern [[Arabia]] in the mid-19th century * [[Faisal Al-Dakhil]], [[Kuwait]]i footballer * [[Faisal Al-Dawish]], [[Saudi]] leader of [[ikhwan]] * [[Faisal Ali Warabe]], [[Somali people|Somali]] politician * [[Faisal Faisal]], [[Iraq]]i skeleton slider * [[Faisal Iqbal]], [[Pakistani people|Pakistani]] cricketer * [[Faisal Islam]], British Bangladeshi economics editor and correspondent for Channel 4 News * [[Faisal Rehman]], a Pakistani film and television actor * [[Faisal Saif]], an Indian a film director * [[Faisal Shahzad]], terrorist responsible for [[2010 Times Square car bomb attempt]] * [[Faisal Bezzine]], Tunisian actor ==Places== * [[Faisal Mosque]], largest [[mosque]] in [[Islamabad]], [[Pakistan]] * [[Faisalabad]], third largest city in [[Punjab (Pakistan)|Punjab]], [[Pakistan]] {{hndis}} [[Category:Arabic masculine given names]]
